p: Alternatively, the antibacterial activity of the isolated compounds ( 1– 7) was reported ( Table 4). Except compounds 1 and 5, all compounds were active against the whole test bacterial strains (9 ~ 22 mm). Compound 2 was the most active one against Enterococcus faecalis (22 ± 0.13 mm). According to our MIC and MBC studies ( Table 5), it has been investigated that compound 4 showed the lowest MIC and MBC (1.15 and 2.05 mg/mL), indicating its highest antibacterial activity, while compound 7 recorded the highest MIC and MBC (2.48 and 3.00 mg/mL), i.e. lowest activity, although Kumarasamy et al ( Kumarasamy et al., 2004) reported no significant antimicrobial activity for the latter. Finally, compound 6 showed a consistent activity with previously reported data ( Kumarasamy et al., 2004).
